title: Put into Low Priority Queue for Network problems...

replies.body: It's possible since either your team members have reported you or that from your disconnection that has been 3 minutes twice in game that depends on how long it took you to reconnect/disconnect to the client would  determine you having to be put on low priority queue.

Firstly, leavebuster doesn't punish for "just one game". You'd need to leave a significant amount of games before it does. Secondly, it doesn't take long for leavebuster to recognise you as a "leaver" (5 minutes if I remember correctly) and it doesn't matter if you reconnect after that point. Thirdly, even if you were reported as "AFK/Leaver" by everyone in that game as well it still wouldn't be enough for leavebuster to punish you, in regards to reports it operates based on consistency not quantity. Lastly, as Yaiamone has mentioned, leavebuster can't tell why you left in most/all cases.

Basically you've probably been recognised as a "leaver" in several other games prior to this one and/or been reported as such **consistently**.

Riot does not know that this is a one-off. The Low Priority Queue is not a punishment, it is a way for Riot to check whether the problem is fixed. If your computer cannot stay connected to their servers for the 20 minutes of queue time, it would be bad to let you join another ranked game and have your bad internet connection ruin it for everyone else.

Leaver buster is automatic and can't tell why you left. It saw you as a leaver and punished you according to what it had been programmed to do .
